quoteTime: about three o’clock in the afternoon
quoteLast: . Noel Brooke and Gerald went to the Lindell House and registered. An hour later, in the lobby of the hotel, looking, it must be confessed, rather out of place in his elegant surroundings, they recognized the familiar figure of Samuel Standish.
title: A Debt of Honor: The Story of Gerald Lane's Success in the Far West
author: Alger, Horatio, Jr., 1832-1899; Davis, J. Watson, 1870-1959 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: The industry in question is the manufacture of fuel from coal-dust by moulding the latter in suitable machines with pitch so as to form the cakes known as "briquettes" or "patent fuel." By this means two waste materials are disposed of in a useful way--the pitch and the finely-divided coal, which could not conveniently be used as fuel by itself. From
quoteLast: million tons of this artificial fuel are being made annually here and on the Continent.
title: Coal, and What We Get from It
author: Meldola, Raphael, 1849-1915

quoteFirst: Here and there through the cave there are immense pits or chasms, only some few yards in circumference, but from
quoteLast: hundred feet in depth. A piece of paper saturated in oil is thrown down and displays the fearful gulf, the bottom of which appears to have the same formation of rock and clay as the top.
title: With the World's Great Travellers, Volume 1

quoteLast: tenths of a millimeter to three or four millimeters or more.

quoteFirst: No one knows what the Spring tactics of General Joffre will be. Along the section of the front I visited the officers are all satisfied that the Commander in Chief's "nibbling tactics" have forced the Germans to retire on the average of
quoteLast: miles all along the line. The very name of that great man is spoken with reverence, almost with awe, by his "children at the front."
title:

quoteFirst: The sporangium described by the English author is circular in section and measures 0·65 × 0·53 mm.; the wall is in part composed of a single layer of cells and in part of
quoteLast: layers, a character recalling the “annulate” sporangia of _Botryopteris_. Between the spore-mass and the wall is an interrupted ring of short tracheal elements similar to the xylem-mantle which occurs at the periphery of the nucellus of certain Palaeozoic gymnospermous seeds.
title: Fossil plants, Vol. 2
author: Seward, A. C. (Albert Charles), 1863-1941

quoteFirst: However, we had become thoroughly disgusted with the place and conditions (the hotel man having arbitrarily charged us $25 for the hole we burned in his cheap pine floor), and were glad to get out of town by any route and at any cost. We all clambered aboard and were off at
quoteLast: As we sat perched up on top of that load of luggage and merchandise when the boat pulled out of the harbor we must have looked more like pelicans sitting on a huge floating log than like "Americanos ricos" in search of rubber, vanilla and coffee lands.
title: A Journey in Southeastern Mexico
author: Harper, Henry Howard, 1871-1953
